content.title: Kinematics
content.definition: Study of motion without considering forces
content.statement: Kinematics is the branch of classical mechanics that describes the motion of objects without considering the forces that cause the motion.

explanation.intuition: Kinematics answers 'how does it move?' without asking 'why does it move?' It describes position, velocity, and acceleration as functions of time.
explanation.key_insight: The fundamental kinematic equations relate displacement, initial velocity, final velocity, acceleration, and time. They apply when acceleration is constant.
explanation.technical_details: The kinematic equations: v = v₀ + at, x = x₀ + v₀t + ½at², v² = v₀² + 2a(x - x₀), x = x₀ + ½(v₀ + v)t

citations.source: Halliday, D., Resnick, R., & Walker, J. (2021). Fundamentals of Physics, 12th ed. Wiley.
Young, H.D., & Freedman, R.A. (2020). University Physics, 15th ed. Pearson.
